Wrightway has a local monopoly on transportation services from Burginville’s city center to its airport. Wrightway’s average variable cost and marginal cost for each trip are constant at <math alttext="$8" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>8</mn></math>. Wrightway incurs a <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>20</mn></math> cost each day regardless of the number of trips it provides. The table above shows the price per trip that Wrightway can charge for different numbers of trips provided in a day.

(a) Calculate the profit-maximizing number of trips for Wrightway to provide each day. Show your work.

(b) What is the allocatively efficient number of trips per day?

(c) Suppose the Burginville City Council is considering two proposals to get Wrightway to reduce deadweight loss from the provision of rides.

• Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math>: Grant a <math alttext="$35" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>35</mn></math> daily subsidy to Wrightway

• Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mi>II</mi></math>: Grant a <math alttext="$5" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>5</mn></math> per trip subsidy to Wrightway

(i) How many trips would Wrightway provide each day under Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

(ii) How many trips would Wrightway provide each day under Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

(iii) Which of the two proposals is preferable to the Burginville City Council? Explain.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
